snippet: One of the earliest churches in the Roman Forum has been partially restored and is scheduled to reopen for tour groups in September.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Santa Maria Antiqua, one of the earliest churches in Rome, has been partially restored and is scheduled to reopen for tour groups in September; psychedelic rock posters of the 1960s and 70s are celebrated in exhibit Byrd/Skolnick: A Tale of Two Posters at the Museum at Bethel Woods in Bethel, NY, and book Electrical Banana: Masters of Psychedelic Art by Norman Hathaway and Dan Nadel; exhibit The Louvre and the Tuileries Garden will open at the High Museum of Art in Atlanta in November.
lead_paragraph: One of the earliest churches in the Roman Forum has been partially restored and is scheduled to reopen for tour groups in September.
